intro: Wahlenbergia galpiniae var. excedens, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It features slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
